metadata.titleEn: Data set of I-type granite and its accessory minerals in Zhalantun area, Northeast China
metadata.description: The data are U-Pb isotopic dating data of I-type granite in Zhalantun area, major and trace geochemical data of whole rock, major and trace data of plagioclase and biotite, major and trace geochemical data of accessory minerals zircon and apatite, and in-situ Nd isotopic data of apatite. The samples were collected from three types of I-type granites in Zhalantun area, Daxinganling, Northeast China. U-Pb isotopic chronology data were obtained by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The major and trace geochemical data of the whole rock are obtained by X-ray fluorescence spectrometry and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The major and trace geochemical data of minerals are obtained by electron probe microanalysis and laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. In situ Nd isotopic geochemical data of minerals were obtained by multi receiver laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The obtained data can define the age and source characteristics of regional magmatism, and reveal that zircon and apatite in granite can effectively trace the evolution of granitic magma.
metadata.instructions: All data are stored in Excel file. The file name is "WR"_ Majtra "represents the major and trace geochemical data of the whole rock," ZrN "_ UPB "represents zircon U-Pb isotopic composition and age data," ZrN "_ HF "represents in-situ Hf isotopic data of zircon," ZrN "_ Majtra "represents the major and trace element geochemical data of zircon," AP "_ Majtra "represents the major and trace element geochemical data of apatite," AP "_ "Nd" stands for apatite in situ nd radioisotope data, "ZrN"_ "Traparcoe" stands for the calculation data of trace element partition coefficient of zircon, "WR"_ NBO "represents the whole rock NBO / T calculation data," minmajtra "represents the mineral major and trace element data.

Definition.Question: What does 'U-Pb isotopic dating' mean in the context of data collection methods for I-type granites?
Definition.Answer: U-Pb isotopic dating in the context of data collection methods for I-type granites refers to the analysis of zircon minerals using laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry to determine the age of magmatic activity in a region by measuring the uranium-lead isotopic ratios.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the selection of specific data collection methods, such as laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, when analyzing zircon U-Pb isotopes in granitic rocks?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The selection of data collection methods like laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry for analyzing zircon U-Pb isotopes in granitic rocks is influenced by the need for precise isotopic age determination, the ability to analyze small mineral grains, and the requirement for high sensitivity and accuracy in measuring isotopic ratios to define the magmatic activity period and source characteristics of the region.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of collecting U-Pb isotopic dating data and mineral geochemical data from I-type granites in the Zalantun region of Northeast China?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective is to constrain the timing of magmatic activity and the characteristics of the source region, as well as to reveal how zircon and apatite within the granites can effectively trace the evolution of granitic magmatism.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the instrumental techniques used to collect U-Pb isotopic dating data and geochemical data from I-type granite samples in the Zalantun area, and how can these techniques be optimized for better accuracy?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: U-Pb isotopic dating data is collected using laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) on zircon minerals. Whole-rock major and trace geochemical data are obtained using X-ray fluorescence spectrometry (XRF) and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS). Mineral major and trace geochemical data are collected using electron probe micro-analysis (EPMA) and LA-ICP-MS. In-situ Nd isotopic geochemical data are acquired using multi-collector LA-ICP-MS. These techniques can be optimized by ensuring proper calibration, using high-purity standards, and conducting repeated analyses to verify the reproducibility and accuracy of the results.

Enablement.Question: What advanced analytical techniques enable the precise determination of U-Pb isotopic ages in granitic samples?
Enablement.Answer: The precise determination of U-Pb isotopic ages in granitic samples is enabled by the use of laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) to analyze zircon U-Pb isotopes.
